page.title: 10Local Farming and Fishing
page.content:
Most of the local farms are on rough grassland and are used for grazing sheep & beef cattle. One local farmer has a dairy herd. At one time strawberries were grown here on a commercial basis but to day they are only grown in private gardens or allotments. There are a few small market gardens but most of the food is imported.
In former times there were many fishing boats in the harbour. The two remaining to day are mainly used for gathering crabs and lobsters and taking out fishing parties in the season, when they mainly catch mackerel & pollock. A few folk who don't mind wading up to their waists in cold water gather prawns from the rocky headlands at low tide.
